00098 /** \name Create new sequence from scratch. */
00099 //-------------------------------
00100 //@{
00101 
00102 /**
00103  * \ingroup  Sequence
00104  * \brief  Create a new sequence.
00105  *
00106  * \description
00107  *
00108  *    Create a new, in-memory, sequence.
00109  *
00110  * \modifications  
00111  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
00112  */
00113 FC_ReturnCode fc_createSequence(
00114   FC_Dataset dataset,    /**< input - dataset to create sequence in */
00115   char *seqname,         /**< input - name of sequence */
00116   FC_Sequence *sequence  /**< output - new sequence handle */
00117 ) {
00118   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00119   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
00120   int *temp_slotIDs;
00121   
00122   // default return value
00123   if (sequence)
00124     *sequence = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00125   
00126   // check input
00127   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
00128   if (dsSlot == NULL || !seqname || !sequence) {
00129     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00130     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00131   }
00132   
00133   // log message
00134   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating new sequence '%s'", seqname);
00135 
00136   // get an open slot
00137   seqSlot = _fc_getNewSeqSlot();
00138   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
00139     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00140     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00141   }
00142   
00143   // table header information
00144   _FC_GET_HANDLE(*sequence, seqSlot);
00145   _fc_setSlotHeaderName(&(seqSlot->header), seqname);
00146   
00147   // set back and forth references
00148   seqSlot->ds = dataset;
00149   
00150   // update owning dataset with info about this sequence
00151   temp_slotIDs = realloc(dsSlot->seqIDs, sizeof(int) * (dsSlot->numSeq + 1));
00152   if (temp_slotIDs == NULL) {
00153     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00154     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00155   }
00156   temp_slotIDs[dsSlot->numSeq] = seqSlot->header.slotID;
00157   dsSlot->seqIDs = temp_slotIDs;
00158   dsSlot->numSeq++;
00159   
00160   return FC_SUCCESS;
00161 }
00162 
00163 /**
00164  * \ingroup  Sequence
00165  * \brief  Set the sequence coordinates by copy.
00166  *
00167  * \description
00168  *  
00169  *    Set the coordinates for the sequence. Must provide the number of steps,
00170  *    the data type, and a pointer to the 1-D array of coordinates.
00171  *    This routine makes a copy of the coords for the library,
00172  *    so the user still has responsibility of the original buffer.
00173  *    If you would like to give the coordinates array to the sequence instead
00174  *    of just copying them, use fc_setSequenceCoordsPtr().
00175  *
00176  *    You cannot set coords if they already exist.
00177  *
00178  * \modifications 
00179  *    - 2003-NOV-13  WSK  Created
00180  *    - 09/10/04 WSK, changed so cannot set coords more than once.
00181  */
00182 FC_ReturnCode fc_setSequenceCoords(
00183   FC_Sequence sequence,  /**< Input - Sequence handle */
00184   int numStep,           /**< Input - Number of steps in the sequence */
00185   FC_DataType dataType,  /**< Input - The data type of the coordinate array
00186                                       (i.e. int, float, etc) */
00187   void *coords           /**< Input - Array of coordinate data */
00188 ) {
00189   int size;
00190   _FC_SeqSlot *seqSlot;
00191   
00192   // NOTE!: if you change stuff here, also change fc_setSetSequenceCoordsPtr()
00193 
00194   // check input
00195   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
00196   if (seqSlot == NULL || numStep < 1 || !fc_isDataTypeValid(dataType) ||
00197       dataType == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || coords == NULL) {
00198     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00199     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00200   }
00201  
00202   // a little more checking -- can't overwrite coords 
00203   if (seqSlot->coords != NULL || seqSlot->header.committed == 1) {
00204     fc_printfErrorMessage("Coords already exist on sequence '%s'",
00205                           seqSlot->header.name);
00206     return FC_ERROR;
00207   }
00208 
00209   // log message
00210   fc_printfLogMessage("Setting coords on sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
00211 
00212   // Meta data
00213   seqSlot->numStep = numStep;
00214   seqSlot->datatype = dataType;
00215 
00216   // Big data
00217   size = fc_sizeofDataType(dataType);
00218   size *= numStep;
00219   seqSlot->coords = malloc(size);
00220   if (seqSlot->coords == NULL) {
00221     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00222       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00223   }
00224   memcpy(seqSlot->coords, coords, size);
00225 
00226   return FC_SUCCESS;
00227 }
00228 
00229 /**
00230  * \ingroup  Sequence
00231  * \brief  Set the pointer to the mesh coordinates.
00232  *
00233  * \description
00234  *  
00235  *    Set the coordinates for the sequence. Must provide the number of steps,
00236  *    the data type, and a pointer to the 1-D array of coordinates. 
00237  *    This routine passes the coords array directly to the library,
00238  *    so the user no longer has responsibility of the original buffer.
00239  *    If you would like to keep the coords array, you should use 
00240  *    fc_setSequenceCoords() instead which makes a copy of the coords array.
00241  *
00242  *    You cannot set coords if they already exist.
00243  *
00244  * \modifications 
00245  *    - 10/01/04 WSK, created.
00246  */
00247 FC_ReturnCode fc_setSequenceCoordsPtr(
00248   FC_Sequence sequence,  /**< Input - Sequence handle */
00249   int numStep,           /**< Input - Number of steps in the sequence */
00250   FC_DataType dataType,  /**< Input - The data type of the coordinate array
00251                                       (i.e. int, float, etc) */
00252   void *coords           /**< Input - Array of coordinate data */
00253 ) {
00254   _FC_SeqSlot *seqSlot;
00255   
00256   // NOTE!: if you change stuff here, also change fc_setSetSequenceCoords()
00257 
00258   // check input
00259   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
00260   if (seqSlot == NULL || numStep < 1 || !fc_isDataTypeValid(dataType) ||
00261       dataType == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || coords == NULL) {
00262     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00263     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00264   }
00265  
00266   // a little more checking -- can't overwrite coords 
00267   if (seqSlot->coords != NULL || seqSlot->header.committed == 1) {
00268     fc_printfErrorMessage("Coords already exist on sequence '%s'",
00269                           seqSlot->header.name);
00270     return FC_ERROR;
00271   }
00272 
00273   // log message
00274   fc_printfLogMessage("Setting coords on sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
00275 
00276   // Meta data
00277   seqSlot->numStep = numStep;
00278   seqSlot->datatype = dataType;
00279 
00280   // Big data
00281   seqSlot->coords = coords;
00282 
00283   return FC_SUCCESS;
00284 }

00288 /** \name Other ways to get new sequences. */
00289 //-------------------------------
00290 //@{
00291 
00292 /**
00293  * \ingroup  Sequence
00294  * \brief  Copy a sequence
00295  *
00296  * \description
00297  *  
00298  *    Create a copy of a sequence, in the specified dataset, with the 
00299  *    given name.
00300  *
00301  * \todo
00302  *    Perhaps somehow flag when the destination dataset is the same
00303  *    as the source dataset. Also do this for other copies. Very useful
00304  *    for fc_copyVariable.
00305  *
00306  * \modifications 
00307  *   - 2003-NOV-11 WSK Created
00308  *   - 2008-MAR-26 CDU Updated to allow zero-length sequences
00309  */
00310 FC_ReturnCode fc_copySequence(
00311   FC_Sequence src_seq, /**< Input - the source sequence to be copied */
00312   FC_Dataset dest_ds, /**< Input - the destination dataset to be copied into */
00313   char *newName,       /**< Input - the name of the new sequence, a NULL value
00314                             is a flag to use the name of the source sequence */
00315   FC_Sequence* new_seq /**< Output - handle to the new sequence */
00316 ) { 
00317   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00318   _FC_DsSlot* dest_dsSlot;
00319   _FC_SeqSlot* src_seqSlot;
00320   int numStep;
00321   FC_DataType dataType;
00322   void* coords;
00323 
00324   // default return
00325   if (new_seq)
00326     *new_seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00327 
00328   // check input
00329   dest_dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dest_ds);
00330   src_seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(src_seq);
00331   if (dest_dsSlot == NULL || src_seqSlot == NULL || new_seq == NULL) {
00332     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00333     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00334   }
00335 
00336   // test for NULL name
00337   if (newName == NULL)
00338     newName = src_seqSlot->header.name;
00339 
00340   // log message
00341   fc_printfLogMessage("Copying sequence '%s' to '%s'", 
00342                       src_seqSlot->header.name, newName);
00343 
00344   // get src data
00345   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(src_seq, &numStep, &dataType);
00346   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00347     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get info for sequence '%s'",
00348                           src_seqSlot->header.name);
00349     return rc;
00350   }
00351   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(src_seq, &coords);
00352   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00353     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get coords for sequence '%s'",
00354                           src_seqSlot->header.name);
00355     return rc;
00356   }
00357 
00358   // create new sequence 
00359   rc = fc_createSequence(dest_ds, newName, new_seq);
00360   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00361     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to create sequence '%s'", newName);
00362     return rc;
00363   }
00364 
00365   // Copy the coordinates
00366   if(numStep==0){
00367     //Some datasets have sequences that have 0 steps (eg, Cubit
00368     //will add a sequence named "time" that has 0 steps). Thus, we
00369     //allow users to copy the empty subset from one dataset to another.
00370     fc_printfWarningMessage("Copying an empty sequence named '%s'",
00371                    src_seqSlot->header.name );
00372 
00373   } else {
00374     rc = fc_setSequenceCoords(*new_seq, numStep, dataType, coords);
00375     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00376       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to set coords for sequence '%s'", newName);
00377       return rc;
00378     }
00379   }
00380 
00381   return rc;
00382 }
00383 
00384 
00385 /** 
00386  * \ingroup Sequence
00387  * \brief Given a seq, return a new sequence that is the old one shifted and scaled.
00388  *
00389  * \description
00390  *
00391  *    Given a seq, return a new sequence that is the old one shifted and
00392  *    scaled.  Possible usage: This function can be followed by
00393  *    fc_copySeqVariable in order to create a new seqVar that is an oldSeqVar
00394  *    normalized in time such that it starts at time zero.
00395  *    
00396  *    The shift is applied before the scale. 
00397  *    i.e., new_seq_val = (old_seq_val+shift)*(scale).
00398  *    If you don't want to shift, pass in 0 for the shift; if you
00399  *    dont want to scale pass in 1 for the scale.
00400  *
00401  *
00402  *    The datatype of the new sequence is FC_DT_DOUBLE regardless of
00403  *    the original sequence datatype.
00404  *
00405  *    This returns with an error if the orignal sequence is not numerical.
00406  *    Scaling by zero is not allowed.
00407  *
00408  * \todo change this so the user can specify the return type.
00409  *
00410  * \modifications
00411  *    6/14/05 ACG created. 
00412  *
00413  */
00414 FC_ReturnCode fc_shiftAndScaleSequence(
00415   FC_Sequence src_seq, /**< Input - the source sequence to be shifted and scaled */
00416   FC_Dataset dest_ds, /**< Input - the destination dataset to be copied into */
00417   double shift, /**< input - val shifting seq by */ 
00418   double scale, /**< input - val scaling seq by */ 
00419   char *newName,       /**< Input - the name of the new sequence */
00420   FC_Sequence* new_seq /**< Output - handle to the new sequence */
00421 ) { 
00422   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00423 
00424   _FC_DsSlot* dest_dsSlot;
00425   _FC_SeqSlot* src_seqSlot;
00426   int numStep;
00427   FC_DataType seqdatatype;
00428   double* prev;
00429   void* coordsp;
00430   int i;
00431 
00432   // default return
00433   if (new_seq)
00434     *new_seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00435 
00436   // check input
00437   dest_dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dest_ds);
00438   src_seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(src_seq);
00439   if (dest_dsSlot == NULL || src_seqSlot == NULL ||
00440       new_seq == NULL || newName == NULL) {
00441     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00442     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00443   }
00444 
00445   // log message
00446   fc_printfLogMessage("shifting and scaling sequence '%s' to '%s'", 
00447                       src_seqSlot->header.name, newName);
00448 
00449   if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(scale,0.0)){
00450     fc_printfErrorMessage("scaling by zero is not allowed");
00451     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00452   }
00453 
00454   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo (src_seq, &numStep, &seqdatatype);
00455   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00456     return rc;
00457   }
00458 
00459   if (!(seqdatatype == FC_DT_INT || seqdatatype == FC_DT_FLOAT ||
00460         seqdatatype == FC_DT_DOUBLE)){
00461     fc_printfErrorMessage("seq data type is not numerical");
00462     return FC_ERROR;
00463   }
00464 
00465   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(src_seq,&coordsp);
00466   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
00467     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00468     return FC_ERROR;
00469   }
00470 
00471 
00472   prev = (double*)malloc(numStep*sizeof(double));
00473   if (prev == NULL){
00474     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s","cant make data array");
00475     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00476     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00477   }
00478 
00479   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++){
00480     switch(seqdatatype){
00481     case FC_DT_INT:
00482       prev[i] = (double)(((int*)coordsp)[i]);
00483       break;
00484     case FC_DT_FLOAT:
00485       prev[i] = (double)(((float*)coordsp)[i]);
00486       break;
00487     default: //know its a double
00488       prev[i] = ((double*)coordsp)[i];
00489       break;
00490     }
00491 
00492     //this isnt quite ideal - e.g., if magnitude of both shift and scale are small...
00493     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(prev[i],-shift)){
00494       prev[i] = 0.0;
00495     }else{
00496       prev[i]+=shift;
00497       if (!FC_DBL_EQUIV(scale,1.0)){
00498         prev[i]*=scale;
00499       }
00500     }
00501   }
00502 
00503   // create new sequence 
00504   rc = fc_createSequence(dest_ds, newName, new_seq);
00505   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00506     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to create sequence '%s'", newName);
00507     free(prev);
00508     return rc;
00509   }
00510 
00511   // set new seq coords
00512   rc = fc_setSequenceCoordsPtr(*new_seq,numStep,FC_DT_DOUBLE,(void*)prev);
00513   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
00514     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00515     free(prev);
00516     fc_deleteSequence(*new_seq);
00517     *new_seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00518     return FC_ERROR;
00519   }
00520   
00521   return rc;
00522 }
00523 
00524 
00525 /** 
00526  * \ingroup Sequence
00527  * \brief Creates a sequence of specified length, starting at a given
00528  *        val with subsequent vals spaced by given stepsize
00529  *
00530  * \description
00531  *
00532  *        Creates a sequence of specified with starting at a given
00533  *        val with subsequent vals spaced by given stepsize. Stepsize
00534  *        cannot = 0 unless it requesting a single stepsize sequence.
00535  *        If want a single stepsize sequence the spacing requested
00536  *        doesnt matter.
00537  *
00538  *        Return seq data type is FC_DT_DOUBLE.
00539  *
00540  *        This routine is often used as a companion function to 
00541  *        functions in the timeseries module. This function can
00542  *        be used to create a common sequence for two sequence
00543  *        variables. The old variables can be put on the new sequence
00544  *        using fc_LinearInterpolation and then used in the comparison
00545  *        routines in the timeseries module.
00546  *
00547  *        This is also is a companion function to the private function
00548  *        _fc_createSeqVariableFromRegularVariable in the timeseries module
00549  *        used in some test modules.In this way 2 sequence variables can be 
00550  *        created from 2 different multi-datapoint variables and used in
00551  *        the comparison routines in the timeseries module, since they will
00552  *        be on the same sequence. 
00553  *
00554  * \todo should there be another version where you set the bounds rather than
00555  *       the stepsize to avoid roundoff issues ?
00556  *
00557  * \modifications  
00558  *    - 2/2/05 ACG, created from being split out from 
00559  *      fc_createSeqvariableFromVariable
00560  *    - 2/10/05 ACG changed so takes an offset and a step size.
00561  *    - 2/10/05 ACG moved to private becuase thats where the companion
00562  *              functions _fc_createSeqVariableFromRegularVariable is.
00563  *              This may be useful and perhaps put in Sequence module, on
00564  *              the other hand its sufficiently short that maybe it cannot
00565  *              justify its existence.
00566  *    - 4/12/05 ACG and now we need it for comparing variables on
00567  *              different sequences.
00568  *    - 4/21/05 ACG moved it here from its previous home in timeseries.
00569  *    - 4/27/05 ACG better handling of single data point sequences
00570  *
00571  */
00572 FC_ReturnCode fc_createRegularSequence(
00573   FC_Dataset dset, /**< input - dataset for the sequence */
00574   int numStep, /**< input - numstep in created seq */
00575   double offset, /**< initial val in the sequence */ 
00576   double stepsize, /**< spacing of the sequence */ 
00577   char* seq_name, /**< input - name of the new sequence that will be created */
00578   FC_Sequence *seq /**< output - handle to the new sequence */
00579 ){
00580 
00581   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00582   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00583   double *times;
00584   int k;
00585 
00586 
00587   // default return
00588   if (seq)
00589     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00590 
00591   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dset);
00592   if (dsSlot == NULL || !seq_name || !seq || numStep < 1){
00593     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00594     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00595   }
00596 
00597   if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(stepsize,0.0) && numStep != 1){
00598     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant ask for more than 1 step but zero step size");
00599     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00600   }
00601 
00602   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating regular sequence");
00603 
00604   rc = fc_createSequence(dset,seq_name,seq);
00605   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00606     fc_deleteSequence(*seq);
00607     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00608     return rc;
00609   }
00610 
00611 
00612   times = (double*)malloc(numStep*sizeof(double));
00613   times[0] = offset;
00614   for (k = 1; k < numStep; k++){
00615     times[k] = times[k-1]+stepsize;
00616   }
00617       
00618   rc = fc_setSequenceCoords(*seq,numStep,FC_DT_DOUBLE,times);
00619   free(times);
00620   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00621     fc_deleteSequence(*seq);
00622     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00623     return rc;
00624   }
00625 
00626   return FC_SUCCESS;
00627 
00628 }
00629 
00630 
00631 /** 
00632  * \ingroup Sequence
00633  * \brief Given an array of sequences on the same dataset, creates a new 
00634  *        regularly spaced sequence whose range is the intersection
00635  *        of the sequences.
00636  *
00637  * \description
00638  *
00639  *        Given an array of sequences on the same dataset, creates a new 
00640  *        regularly spaced sequence whose range is the intersection
00641  *        of the sequences. Input sequences must be numerical, but dont
00642  *        have to be same datatype. Input sequences must be 
00643  *        monotonically increasing. New seq data type is FC_DT_DOUBLE.
00644  *        Seq is null if no valid range. If numStep == 0, then it
00645  *        returns a sequence with the greatest number of steps that
00646  *        an input sequence has on that range. 
00647  *
00648  *        This routine is often used as a companion function to 
00649  *        functions in the timeseries module. This function creates
00650  *        a common sequence for two or more sequence variables. The
00651  *        old variables can be put on the new sequence
00652  *        using fc_LinearInterpolation and then used in the comparison
00653  *        routines in the timeseries module.
00654  *
00655  * \todo
00656  *     see if can combine this with rc_getIntersectingRangeRegularSequence 
00657  *
00658  * \modifications  
00659  *    - 4/25/05 ACG created.
00660  *    - 4/27/05 ACG better handling of single data point sequences
00661  *    - 4/28/05 ACG explicitly set last point of seq to timemax to
00662  *              avoid roundoff issues as a result of createRegularSequence
00663  *              being based on stepsize rather than range. if we make a
00664  *              another version of createRegularSequence that is based on
00665  *              ranage, then use that version here.
00666  *    - 5/13/05 ACG works for non-monotonic sequences so that
00667  *              can use this to check for any overlap to begin with. of course
00668  *              if you are going to map a seq var onto a new seq that was
00669  *              calculated by this method, then the seqvar will have to
00670  *              be made into a monotonic seq to before the interpolation.
00671  *              This change utilizes the new stats function 
00672  *              fc_getSequenceMinMaxMonotonicity.
00673  *    - 5/16/05 ACG making this so has to be monotonically increasing.
00674  *              this makes things easier for doing the automatic
00675  *              numsteps option.
00676  *    - 5/17/05 ACG added default case of numStep == 0 returns max
00677  *              number of steps that the input sequences have on that
00678  *              range. in this way you dont lose any resolution that an
00679  *              input sequence has (well, you kind of do if it wasnt regularly
00680  *              spaced to begin with) and you wont gain any when you do
00681  *              a linear interpolation over the new sequence becuase its just
00682  *              more points over what was a linear segment in the original
00683  *              resolution anyway. 
00684  *    - 6/27/05 ACG updated to use new getClosestSequenceValue
00685  *
00686  */
00687 FC_ReturnCode fc_createIntersectingRegularSequence(
00688   int numseqs,/**< input - num of seqs in orig sequence array */
00689   FC_Sequence *seqs,/**< input - orig sequence array */
00690   int numStep, /**< input - numstep in created seq */
00691   char* seqName, /**<input - name of created sequence */
00692   FC_Sequence *seq /**< output - handle to the new sequence */
00693   ){
00694 
00695   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00696   FC_Dataset dset, dsetcomp;
00697   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00698   double timemin, timemincomp, timemax, timemaxcomp, timespacing;
00699   void *data;
00700   int nstep;
00701   int mono,monocomp;
00702   FC_DataType datatype;
00703   int i;
00704 
00705 
00706   if (seq)
00707     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00708 
00709   if (!seqName || !seq || numStep < 0 || numseqs < 1 || !seqs){
00710     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00711     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00712   }
00713 
00714   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating Intersecting regular sequence");
00715 
00716   if (!fc_isSequenceValid(seqs[0])){
00717     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00718     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00719   }
00720 
00721   rc = fc_getDatasetFromSequence (seqs[0], &dset);
00722   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00723     fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot get dataset from sequence");
00724     return FC_ERROR;
00725   }
00726 
00727   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dset);
00728   if (dsSlot == NULL){
00729     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00730     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00731   }
00732 
00733   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(seqs[0], &nstep,&datatype);
00734   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00735     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq info");
00736     return FC_ERROR;
00737   }
00738 
00739   if (datatype != FC_DT_INT && datatype != FC_DT_FLOAT &&
00740       datatype != FC_DT_DOUBLE){
00741     fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid sequence datatype");
00742     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00743   }
00744 
00745   for (i= 1; i < numseqs; i++){
00746     if (!fc_isSequenceValid(seqs[i])){
00747       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00748       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00749     }
00750     rc = fc_getDatasetFromSequence (seqs[i], &dsetcomp);
00751     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00752       fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot get dataset from sequence");
00753       return FC_ERROR;
00754     }
00755     
00756     if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(dset,dsetcomp)){
00757       fc_printfErrorMessage("Input sequences not on same dataset");
00758       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00759     } 
00760 
00761     rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(seqs[i], &nstep,&datatype);
00762     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00763       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq info");
00764       return FC_ERROR;
00765     }
00766 
00767     if (datatype != FC_DT_INT && datatype != FC_DT_FLOAT &&
00768         datatype != FC_DT_DOUBLE){
00769       fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid sequence datatype");
00770       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00771     }
00772   }
00773 
00774 
00775   rc = fc_getSequenceMinMaxMono(seqs[0],&timemin,NULL,
00776                                 &timemax,NULL,&mono);
00777   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00778     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get minmax of sequence");
00779     return FC_ERROR;
00780   }
00781 
00782   if (mono != 1 && mono != 2){
00783     fc_printfErrorMessage("invalid monotonicity for this sequence");
00784     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00785   }
00786 
00787 
00788   for (i = 1; i < numseqs; i++){
00789     rc = fc_getSequenceMinMaxMono(seqs[i],&timemincomp,NULL,
00790                                   &timemaxcomp,NULL,&monocomp);
00791     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00792       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get minmax of sequence");
00793       return FC_ERROR;
00794     }
00795 
00796 
00797     //leaving this construction in case switch to allowing decreasing later
00798     if (!(monocomp == 1 || monocomp ==2)){ //increasing or single point
00799       fc_printfErrorMessage("invalid monotonicity for this call");
00800       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00801     } else {
00802       if (mono == 2){
00803         //its gotta be single point sequence
00804         mono = monocomp;
00805       }
00806     }
00807 
00808     //want narrowest bounds
00809     if (timemincomp > timemin) timemin= timemincomp;
00810     if (timemaxcomp < timemax) timemax= timemaxcomp;
00811 
00812     if (timemin > timemax){
00813       //no interesecting bounds - bad input set, but dont want to error
00814       fc_printfErrorMessage("no intersecting range");
00815       return FC_ERROR;
00816     }
00817   }
00818 
00819   //now have valid range
00820   
00821   //if numStep == 0 need to calc numStep
00822   if (numStep == 0){
00823     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(timemax,timemin)){
00824       numStep = 1; //just make single point sequence
00825     } else {
00826       double closemintime, closemaxtime;
00827       int closeminindex, closemaxindex;
00828       int npts;
00829       int holdnpts = -1;
00830 
00831       for (i = 0; i < numseqs; i++){
00832         rc = fc_getClosestSequenceValue(seqs[i],"<=",timemin,&closemintime,
00833                                         &closeminindex);
00834         if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00835           fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get closest seq val");
00836           return FC_ERROR;
00837         }
00838         rc = fc_getClosestSequenceValue(seqs[i],">=",timemax,&closemaxtime,
00839                                         &closemaxindex);
00840         if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00841           fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get closest seq val");
00842           return FC_ERROR;
00843         }
00844         
00845         //know its monotonically increasing
00846         npts = closemaxindex-closeminindex+1;
00847         if (holdnpts == -1 || npts > holdnpts){
00848           holdnpts = npts;
00849         }
00850       }
00851       numStep = holdnpts;
00852     }
00853   }
00854 
00855 
00856   //check for zero range sequences
00857   if (numStep == 1){
00858     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(timemax,timemin)){
00859       //good - createRegularsequence should just return the single
00860       //data point
00861       timespacing = 0.0; //actually this value doesnt matter
00862     } else {
00863       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant have nonzero range with only one data point");
00864       return FC_ERROR;
00865     }
00866   } else {
00867     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(timemin,timemax)){
00868       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant have zero range with more than one data point");
00869       return FC_ERROR;
00870     } else {
00871       //good
00872       timespacing= (timemax-timemin)/((double)numStep-1);
00873     }
00874   }
00875   //printf("new seq: tmin %10g tmax %10g spacing %10g\n",timemin, timemax,
00876   //timespacing);
00877   rc = fc_createRegularSequence(dset,numStep,timemin, timespacing,
00878                                   seqName, seq);
00879   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00880     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to create reg sequence");
00881     return FC_ERROR;
00882   }
00883   
00884   //just in case there are some roundoff issues, lets explicitly set that
00885   //last point to the timemax. (this wont be thread safe since playing 
00886   //with the value thats the return val, but i dont think thats a big issue
00887   //right now
00888   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(*seq, &data);
00889   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00890     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq data");
00891   }else {
00892     ((double*)data)[numStep-1] = timemax;
00893   }
00894 
00895   return FC_SUCCESS;
00896 }
00897 
00898 /** 
00899  * \ingroup Sequence
00900  * \brief Given an array of sequences on the same dataset, and new
00901  *        bounds, creates a new regularly spaced sequence whose range 
00902  *        is that of the given bounds and whose number of steps is
00903  *        the max number of steps that the input sequences have on that
00904  *        range.
00905  *
00906  * \description
00907  *
00908  *        Given an array of sequences on the same dataset, and new
00909  *        bounds, creates a new regularly spaced sequence whose range 
00910  *        is that of the given bounds and whose number of steps is
00911  *        the max number of steps that the input sequences have on that
00912  *        range. This is similar to fc_getIntersectingReqularSequence with
00913  *        input parameter numStep = 0, but where the range is specified, rather
00914  *        than the entire overlapping range.
00915  *
00916  *        Input sequences must be numerical, but dont
00917  *        have to be same datatype. Input sequences must be 
00918  *        monotonically increasing. New seq data type is FC_DT_DOUBLE.
00919  *        The bounds must be included within every input sequence.
00920  *
00921  *        This routine is often used as a companion function to 
00922  *        functions in the timeseries module. This function creates
00923  *        a common sequence for two or more sequence variables. The
00924  *        old variables can be put on the new sequence
00925  *        using fc_LinearInterpolation and then used in the comparison
00926  *        routines in the timeseries module.
00927  *
00928  * \todo
00929  *     see if can combine this with rc_getIntersectingRegularSequence 
00930  *
00931  * \modifications  
00932  *    - 6/27/05 ACG created.
00933  */
00934 FC_ReturnCode fc_createIntersectingRangeRegularSequence(
00935   int numseqs,/**< input - num of seqs in orig sequence array */
00936   FC_Sequence *seqs,/**< input - orig sequence array */
00937   double seqmin,/**< input - min val for new sequence */
00938   double seqmax,/**< input - max val for new sequence */
00939   char* seqName, /**<input - name of created sequence */
00940   FC_Sequence *seq /**< output - handle to the new sequence */
00941   ){
00942 
00943   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00944   FC_Dataset dset, dsetcomp;
00945   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00946   double closemintime, closemaxtime, timespacing;
00947   int closeminindex, closemaxindex;
00948   void *data;
00949   int numStep, holdnpts;
00950   int mono;
00951   FC_DataType datatype;
00952   int i;
00953 
00954   if (seq)
00955     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00956 
00957   if (!seqName || !seq || seqmin > seqmax || numseqs < 1 || !seqs){
00958     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00959     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00960   }
00961 
00962 
00963   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating Intersecting Range regular sequence");
00964 
00965   //checks
00966 
00967   if (!fc_isSequenceValid(seqs[0])){
00968     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00969     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00970   };
00971 
00972   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(seqs[0], &numStep,&datatype);
00973   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00974     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq info");
00975     return FC_ERROR;
00976   }
00977 
00978   if (datatype != FC_DT_INT && datatype != FC_DT_FLOAT &&
00979       datatype != FC_DT_DOUBLE){
00980     fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid sequence datatype");
00981     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00982   }
00983 
00984   rc = fc_getDatasetFromSequence (seqs[0], &dset);
00985   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00986     fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot get dataset from sequence");
00987     return FC_ERROR;
00988   }
00989 
00990   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dset);
00991   if (dsSlot == NULL){
00992     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00993     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00994   }
00995 
00996 
00997   rc = fc_getSequenceMinMaxMono(seqs[0],NULL,NULL,
00998                                 NULL,NULL,&mono);
00999   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01000     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get minmax of sequence");
01001     return FC_ERROR;
01002   }
01003 
01004   if (mono != 1 && mono != 2){
01005     fc_printfErrorMessage("invalid monotonicity for this sequence");
01006     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01007   }
01008 
01009   for (i= 1; i < numseqs; i++){
01010     if (!fc_isSequenceValid(seqs[i])){
01011       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01012       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01013     }
01014     rc = fc_getDatasetFromSequence (seqs[i], &dsetcomp);
01015     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01016       fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot get dataset from sequence");
01017       return FC_ERROR;
01018     }
01019     
01020     if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(dset,dsetcomp)){
01021       fc_printfErrorMessage("Input sequences not on same dataset");
01022       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01023     } 
01024 
01025     rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(seqs[i], &numStep,&datatype);
01026     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01027       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq info");
01028       return FC_ERROR;
01029     }
01030 
01031     if (datatype != FC_DT_INT && datatype != FC_DT_FLOAT &&
01032         datatype != FC_DT_DOUBLE){
01033       fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid sequence datatype");
01034       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01035     }
01036 
01037     rc = fc_getSequenceMinMaxMono(seqs[i],NULL,NULL,
01038                                   NULL,NULL,&mono);
01039     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01040       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get minmax of sequence");
01041       return FC_ERROR;
01042     }
01043 
01044     if (mono != 1 && mono != 2){
01045       fc_printfErrorMessage("invalid monotonicity for this sequence");
01046       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01047     }
01048   }
01049 
01050   //finally ok 
01051 
01052   // now get npts and make sure bounds are valid for all exisitng seqs
01053   // know all are monotonically increasing
01054   holdnpts = -1;
01055   for (i= 0 ; i < numseqs; i++){
01056     int npts;
01057     rc = fc_getClosestSequenceValue(seqs[i],"<=",seqmin,&closemintime,
01058                                     &closeminindex);
01059     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01060       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get closest seq val");
01061       return FC_ERROR;
01062     }
01063 
01064     if (closeminindex == -1){
01065       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s","seqmin is out of bounds for input sequence");
01066       return FC_ERROR;
01067     }
01068 
01069     rc = fc_getClosestSequenceValue(seqs[i],">=",seqmax,&closemaxtime,
01070                                     &closemaxindex);
01071     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01072       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get closest seq val");
01073       return FC_ERROR;
01074     }
01075 
01076     if (closemaxindex == -1){
01077       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s","seqmax is out of bounds for input sequence");
01078       return FC_ERROR;
01079     }
01080         
01081     npts = closemaxindex-closeminindex+1;
01082     if (holdnpts == -1 || npts > holdnpts){
01083       holdnpts = npts;
01084     }
01085   }
01086   numStep = holdnpts;
01087   //now have valid range and numpts
01088 
01089   /*
01090   if (numStep == 1 && !FC_DBL_EQUIV(seqmax,seqmin)){
01091     //got a problem
01092     fc_printfErrorMessage("DEVELOEPR ERROR _ HOW CAN THIS BE ?");
01093     printf("DEVELOEPR ERROR _ HOW CAN THIS BE ?");
01094     return FC_ERROR;
01095   }
01096   */
01097 
01098   //check for zero range sequences
01099   if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(seqmax,seqmin)){
01100     //its realy a single pt sequence
01101     numStep = 1;
01102     timespacing = 0.0; //actually this value doesnt matter
01103   } else {
01104     timespacing= (seqmax-seqmin)/((double)numStep-1);
01105   }
01106 
01107   rc = fc_createRegularSequence(dset,numStep,seqmin, timespacing,
01108                                   seqName, seq);
01109   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01110     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to create reg sequence");
01111     return FC_ERROR;
01112   }
01113   
01114   //just in case there are some roundoff issues, lets explicitly set that
01115   //last point to the seqmax. (this wont be thread safe since playing 
01116   //with the value thats the return val, but i dont think thats a big issue
01117   //right now
01118   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(*seq, &data);
01119   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01120     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq data");
01121   }else {
01122     ((double*)data)[numStep-1] = seqmax;
01123   }
01124 
01125   return FC_SUCCESS;
01126 }
01127 
01128 //@}
01129 
01130 /** \name Get existing sequences. */
01131 //-------------------------------
01132 //@{
01133 
01134 /**
01135  * \ingroup  Sequence
01136  * \brief  Get the sequences in a dataset.
01137  *
01138  * \description
01139  *  
01140  *    This call returns an array of sequences in the dataset.
01141  *    The caller is responsible for freeing the array of sequence handles.
01142  *
01143  * \modifications
01144  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
01145  *    - 11/21/03 RM, added default return numSeq = -1, and 
01146  *               seqNames = NULL if anything is wrong
01147  *    - 9/8/04 WSK, changed to return sequence handles instead of sequence
01148  *               names.
01149  */
01150 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequences(
01151  FC_Dataset dataset,   /**< input - dataset */
01152  int *numSeq,          /**< output - number of sequences returned */
01153  FC_Sequence **sequences  /**< output - array of sequences */
01154 ) {
01155   int i;
01156   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01157   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01158   
01159   // default returns if something goes wrong
01160   if (numSeq != NULL) 
01161     *numSeq = -1;
01162   if (sequences)
01163     *sequences = NULL;  
01164   
01165   // check input
01166   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
01167   if (dsSlot == NULL || numSeq == NULL || sequences == NULL) {
01168     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01169     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01170   }
01171   
01172   // log message
01173   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting sequences from dataset '%s'",
01174                       dsSlot->header.name);
01175   
01176   // get num sequences
01177   *numSeq = dsSlot->numSeq;
01178   
01179   // get sequences
01180   if (dsSlot->numSeq > 0) {
01181     *sequences = malloc(dsSlot->numSeq*sizeof(FC_Sequence));
01182     if (*sequences == NULL) {
01183       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01184       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01185     }
01186     for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numSeq; i++) {
01187       seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlotFromID(dsSlot->seqIDs[i]);
01188       _FC_GET_HANDLE((*sequences)[i], seqSlot);
01189     }
01190   }
01191   
01192   return FC_SUCCESS;
01193 }
01194 
01195 /**
01196  * \ingroup  Sequence
01197  * \brief  Get the number of sequences in a dataset.
01198  *
01199  * \modifications
01200  *    - 9/28/04 WSK, created
01201  */
01202 FC_ReturnCode fc_getNumSequence(
01203  FC_Dataset dataset,   /**< input - dataset */
01204  int *numSeq           /**< output - number of sequences returned */
01205 ) {
01206   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01207   
01208   // default returns if something goes wrong
01209   if (numSeq != NULL) 
01210     *numSeq = -1;
01211   
01212   // check input
01213   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
01214   if (dsSlot == NULL || numSeq == NULL) {
01215     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01216     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01217   }
01218   
01219   // log message
01220   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting number sequences from dataset '%s'",
01221                       dsSlot->header.name);
01222   
01223   // get num sequences
01224   *numSeq = dsSlot->numSeq;
01225   
01226   return FC_SUCCESS;
01227 }
01228 
01229 /**
01230  * \ingroup  Sequence
01231  * \brief  Get all sequences with a given name from a dataset.
01232  *
01233  * \description
01234  *  
01235  *    Returns all sequences on the dataset with the specified name. 
01236  *
01237  * \modifications  
01238  *   - Nancy Collins  Created.
01239  *   - 2003-MAY-30  W Koegler  Moved getting sequence meta data from
01240  *       _fc_setupDsSlot() to here.
01241  *   - 11/25/03 RM, added default return sequence = \ref FC_NULL_SEQUENCE 
01242  *   - 12/01/03 WSK Changed so it removes an uncommitted sequence
01243  *       from the owning dataset's seqID list.
01244  *   - 12/02/03 RM, added checking for NULL sequence
01245  *   - 12/12/03 RM, eliminated _fc_lookup_seqSlot() and _fc_namematch(),
01246  *       those input checking changed and added into the body of this function
01247  *   - 9/8/03 WSK, changed name and moved to dataset (to be next to
01248  *       fc_getSequences) 
01249  *   - 9/22/06 ACG returns array of matching sequences
01250  */
01251 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceByName(
01252  FC_Dataset dataset,    /**< input - handle for this dataset */
01253  char *seqName,         /**< input - name of sequence to get */
01254  int *numSequences,     /**< output - number of matching sequences */
01255  FC_Sequence **sequences  /**< output - handle for this sequence */ 
01256 ) {
01257   int i;
01258   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01259   _FC_SeqSlot *seqSlot;
01260   FC_Sequence sequence;
01261 
01262   FC_Sequence *lmatch = NULL;
01263   int numlmatch, maxnumlmatch;
01264   
01265   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01266   if (numSequences)
01267     *numSequences = -1;
01268   if (sequences) 
01269     *sequences = NULL;
01270   
01271   // check input
01272   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
01273   if (dsSlot == NULL || seqName == NULL || !sequences || !numSequences ) {
01274     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01275     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01276   }
01277   
01278   // log message
01279   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting sequence '%s'", seqName);
01280 
01281   numlmatch = 0;
01282   maxnumlmatch = 0;
01283   
01284   // look for existing slots with the matching name
01285   for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numSeq; i++) {
01286     seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlotFromID(dsSlot->seqIDs[i]);
01287     if (!strcmp(seqSlot->header.name, seqName)) {
01288       _FC_GET_HANDLE(sequence, seqSlot);
01289 
01290       if (lmatch == NULL){
01291      lmatch = (FC_Sequence*)malloc(sizeof(FC_Sequence));
01292      if (lmatch == NULL){
01293        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01294        return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01295      }
01296      numlmatch = 1;
01297      maxnumlmatch = 1;
01298      lmatch[0] = sequence;
01299       }else{
01300      if(numlmatch == maxnumlmatch){
01301        FC_Sequence *temp;
01302        temp = (FC_Sequence*)realloc(lmatch,(2*numlmatch)*sizeof(FC_Sequence));
01303        if (temp == NULL){
01304          fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01305          return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01306        }
01307        maxnumlmatch*=2;
01308        lmatch = temp;
01309      }
01310      lmatch[numlmatch] = sequence;
01311      numlmatch++;
01312       }
01313     }
01314   }
01315 
01316   *numSequences = numlmatch;
01317   *sequences = lmatch;
01318 
01319   return FC_SUCCESS;
01320 }
01321 
01322 //@}
01323 
01324 /** \name Change the name of a sequence. */
01325 //-------------------------------
01326 //@{
01327 
01328 /**
01329  * \ingroup Sequence
01330  * \brief  Change the name of a sequence.
01331  *
01332  * \modifications
01333  *   - 8/24/2005 WSD. Created.
01334  */
01335 FC_ReturnCode fc_changeSequenceName(
01336   FC_Sequence sequence, /**< Input - the sequence. */
01337   char* newName       /**< Input - new name for the sequence. */
01338 ) {
01339   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01340 
01341   // check input
01342   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01343   if (seqSlot == NULL || newName == NULL) {
01344     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01345     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01346   }
01347 
01348   // log message
01349   fc_printfLogMessage("Changing name of sequence from '%s' to '%s'", 
01350                       seqSlot->header.name, newName);
01351   
01352   // Do it
01353   return _fc_setSlotHeaderName(&seqSlot->header, newName);
01354 }
01355 
01356 //@}
01357 
01358 /** \name Release/delete sequences. */
01359 //-------------------------------
01360 //@{
01361 
01362 /**
01363  * \ingroup  Sequence
01364  * \brief  Attempt to minimize sequence's memory usage.
01365  *
01366  * \description
01367  *  
01368  *    Call to try and release un-needed memory in a  sequence. 
01369  *    If the sequence has been saved to disk, the large data is 
01370  *    released. If the sequence has not been saved to disk, this 
01371  *    will do nothing.
01372  *
01373  * \modifications  
01374  *    - 04/19/04 WSK Created.
01375  */
01376 FC_ReturnCode fc_releaseSequence(
01377  FC_Sequence sequence       /**< input - sequence handle */
01378 ) {
01379   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01380   
01381   // special case: releasing a null handle is not an error
01382   if ( FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(sequence, FC_NULL_SEQUENCE)) {
01383     fc_printfWarningMessage("Releasing FC_NULL_SEQUENCE");
01384     return FC_SUCCESS;
01385   }
01386 
01387   // check input
01388   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01389   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
01390     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01391     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01392   }
01393   
01394   // log message
01395   fc_printfLogMessage("Cleaning up sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
01396 
01397   // remove big data if this slot is committed
01398   if (seqSlot->header.committed == 1) {
01399     free(seqSlot->coords);
01400     seqSlot->coords = NULL;
01401   }
01402 
01403   return FC_SUCCESS;
01404 }
01405 
01406 /**
01407  * \ingroup  Sequence
01408  * \brief  Delete a sequence.
01409  *
01410  * \description
01411  * 
01412  *    Call when this sequence is no longer needed. Deleting a NULL
01413  *    sequence handle is not an error, but trying to delete a sequence if any
01414  *    meshes have a sequence variable on it is an error.  So, delete meshes
01415  *    before deleting sequences.
01416  *
01417  * \modifications  
01418  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
01419  *    - 11/25/03 RM, added more input checking, if sequence is 
01420  *      FC_NULL_SEQUENCE) then do nothing and return 
01421  *      success (issue warning if fc_getLibraryVerbosity()). 
01422  *    - 12/01/03 WSK Changed so it removes an uncommitted sequence
01423  *      form the owning dataset's seqID list.
01424  *    - 9/9/04 WSK changed name to delete. Changed behavior so that
01425  *      delete always deletes no matter whether on disk or not.
01426  */
01427 FC_ReturnCode fc_deleteSequence(
01428  FC_Sequence sequence     /**< input - sequence to be deleted */
01429 ) {
01430   int i, j;
01431   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01432   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01433   
01434   // special case: deleting a null handle is not an error
01435   if ( FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(sequence, FC_NULL_SEQUENCE)) {
01436     fc_printfWarningMessage("Deleting FC_NULL_SEQUENCE");
01437     return FC_SUCCESS;
01438   }
01439   
01440   // check input
01441   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01442   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
01443     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01444     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01445   }
01446   
01447   // log message
01448   fc_printfLogMessage("Deleting sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
01449 
01450   // setup
01451   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(seqSlot->ds);
01452 
01453   // special case: don't delete if any mesh has a reference to
01454   for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numMesh; i++) {
01455     _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlotFromID(dsSlot->meshIDs[i]);
01456     for (j = 0; j < meshSlot->numSeqVar; j++) {
01457       _FC_VarSlot* varSlot = _fc_getVarSlotFromID(meshSlot->seqVarIDs[j][0]);
01458       if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(sequence, varSlot->sequence)) {
01459         fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't delete sequence '%s' because mesh '%s' "
01460                               "has a reference to it", seqSlot->header.name,
01461                               meshSlot->header.name);
01462         return FC_ERROR;
01463       }
01464     }
01465   }
01466   
01467   // remove reference from parent dataset
01468   if (dsSlot->numSeq == 1) {
01469     free(dsSlot->seqIDs);
01470     dsSlot->seqIDs = NULL;
01471     dsSlot->numSeq = 0;
01472   }
01473   else {
01474     for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numSeq; i++) {
01475       if (dsSlot->seqIDs[i] == seqSlot->header.slotID)
01476         break;
01477     }
01478     for (j = i+1; j < dsSlot->numSeq; j++) {
01479       dsSlot->seqIDs[j-1] = dsSlot->seqIDs[j];
01480     }
01481     dsSlot->numSeq--;
01482   }
01483 
01484   // clear & delete slot
01485   return _fc_deleteSeqSlot(sequence);
01486 }
01487 
01488 //@}
01489 
01490 /** \name Get sequence metadata. */
01491 //-------------------------------
01492 //@{
01493 
01494 /**
01495  * \ingroup  Sequence
01496  * \brief Check that the handle refers to a valid sequence.
01497  *
01498  * \description
01499  *
01500  *    Returns 1 (true) is the handle is valid, and 0 (false) if it is not.
01501  *
01502  * \modifications  
01503  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Created.
01504  */
01505 int fc_isSequenceValid(
01506   FC_Sequence sequence  /**< input - sequence handle */
01507 ) {
01508   return _fc_isHandleValid(sequence.slotID, sequence.uID, seqTableSize,
01509                            (_FC_SlotHeader**)seqTable);
01510 }
01511 
01512 /**
01513  * \ingroup  Sequence
01514  * \brief  Return name of a sequence.
01515  *
01516  * \description
01517  *  
01518  *    Return the name associated with a sequence handle. Spaced
01519  *    is allocated for the string so it needs to be freed by the
01520  *    user when finished.
01521  *
01522  * \modifications  
01523  *    - Aug, 9, 2002.  W Koegler  Created
01524  *    - 11/25/03 RM, added checking for NULL dataset handle, 
01525  *         default return seqname = NULL if anything is wrong
01526  */
01527 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceName(
01528   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01529   char **seqname          /**< output - sequence name, space allocated here
01530                              and must be freed by user when finished */
01531 ) {
01532   char *cp;
01533   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01534   
01535   // default returns if something goes wrong
01536   if (seqname)
01537     *seqname = NULL;  
01538   
01539   // check input
01540   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01541   if (seqSlot == NULL || seqname == NULL) {
01542     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01543     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01544   }
01545   
01546   // log message
01547   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting name for sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
01548 
01549   // copy name
01550   cp = seqSlot->header.name;
01551   *seqname = malloc(strlen(cp) + 1);
01552   if (*seqname == NULL) {
01553     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01554     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01555   }
01556   strcpy(*seqname, cp);
01557   
01558   return FC_SUCCESS;
01559 }
01560 
01561 /**
01562  * \ingroup  Sequence
01563  * \brief  Get the parent dataset of the sequence.
01564  *
01565  * \modifications  
01566  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
01567  *    - 11/25/03 RM, added default return dataset = \ref FC_NULL_DATASET
01568  *    - 12/22/03 Rm, added checking for input/output dataset == NULL
01569  */
01570 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDatasetFromSequence(
01571   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01572   FC_Dataset *dataset     /**< output - dataset handle */
01573 ) {
01574   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01575   
01576   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01577   if (dataset != NULL) 
01578     *dataset = FC_NULL_DATASET;
01579   
01580   // check input
01581   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01582   if (seqSlot == NULL || dataset == NULL) {
01583     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01584     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01585   }
01586   
01587   // log message
01588   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting dataset from sequence '%s'", 
01589                       seqSlot->header.name);
01590   
01591   // return requested value
01592   *dataset = seqSlot->ds;
01593   
01594   return FC_SUCCESS;
01595 }
01596 
01597 /**
01598  * \ingroup  Sequence
01599  * \brief  Get information about a sequence.
01600  *
01601  * \description
01602  *  
01603  *    Return the number of steps in a sequence, and the datatype of the
01604  *    sequences coordinates.
01605  *
01606  * \modifications 
01607  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
01608  *    - 2003-APR-18  W Koegler  Finishing sequence implementation
01609  *    - 11/25/03 RM, added default return numStep = -1, datatype = 
01610  *      \ref FC_DT_UNKNOWN
01611  */
01612 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceInfo(
01613   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01614   int *numStep,           /**< output - number of steps in the sequence */
01615   FC_DataType *datatype   /**< output - data type of sequence coordinates */
01616 ) {
01617   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01618   
01619   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01620   if (numStep != NULL) 
01621     *numStep = -1 ;
01622   if (datatype != NULL)
01623     *datatype = FC_DT_UNKNOWN;
01624   
01625   // check input
01626   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01627   if (seqSlot == NULL || (!numStep && !datatype)) {
01628     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01629     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01630   }
01631   
01632   // log message
01633   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting info for sequence '%s'", 
01634                       seqSlot->header.name);
01635   
01636   // fill in requested values
01637   if (numStep)
01638     *numStep = seqSlot->numStep;
01639   if (datatype)
01640     *datatype = seqSlot->datatype;
01641   
01642   return FC_SUCCESS;
01643 }
01644 
01645 /**
01646  * \ingroup  Sequence
01647  * \brief  Get number of steps in a sequence.

01651  */
01652 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceNumStep(

01655 ) {

01660     *numStep = -1 ;
01661   
01662   // check input
01663   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01664   if (seqSlot == NULL || !numStep) {
01665     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01666     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01667   }
01668   
01669   // log message
01670   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting numStep for sequence '%s'", 
01671                       seqSlot->header.name);
01672   
01673   // fill in requested values
01674   if (numStep)
01675     *numStep = seqSlot->numStep;
01676   
01677   return FC_SUCCESS;
01678 }
01679

01690 ) {

01704   // log message
01705   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting info for sequence '%s'", 
01706                       seqSlot->header.name);
01707   
01708   // fill in requested value
01709   if (datatype)
01710     *datatype = seqSlot->datatype;

01714 
01715 //@}
01716 
01717 /** \name Get sequence big data. */
01718 //-------------------------------
01719 //@{
01720 
01721 /**
01722  * \ingroup  Sequence
01723  * \brief  Get sequence coordinates
01724  *
01725  * \description
01726  *  
01727  *    Return a pointer to the sequence's coordinate array. This
01728  *    must be treated as read-only.
01729  *
01730  * \modifications 
01731  *   - Nancy Collins Created.
01732  *   - 2003-APR-18  W Koegler  Finishing sequence implementation
01733  *   - 11/25/03 RM, added checking for NULL sequence handle, 
01734  *         default return *coords = NULL, issue an error if 
01735  *         fc_getLibraryVerbosity()
01736  */
01737 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(
01738   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01739   void **coords_p         /**< output - pointer to coord array */
01740   ) {
01741   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01742   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01743   
01744   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01745   if (coords_p)
01746     *coords_p = NULL;
01747   
01748   // check input
01749   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01750   if (seqSlot == NULL || coords_p == NULL) {
01751     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01752     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01753   }
01754   
01755   // log message
01756   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting coords for sequence '%s'", 
01757                       seqSlot->header.name);
01758   
01759   // lazy fetching of sequence coords done here
01760   if (seqSlot->coords == NULL && seqSlot->numStep > 0) {
01761     rc = _fc_readSequenceCoords(sequence);
01762     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01763       fc_printfErrorMessage("Lazy loading of coords of sequence '%s' failed",
01764                             seqSlot->header.name);
01765       return rc;
01766     }
01767   }
01768   
01769   // set return values
01770   *coords_p = seqSlot->coords;
01771   
01772   return FC_SUCCESS;
01773 }
01774 
01775 
01776 /**
01777  * \ingroup  Sequence
01778  * \brief  Get a copy of the sequence's coords as the requested data type
01779  *
01780  * \description
01781  *  
01782  *    Returns the sequence's data as the type requested by the user.
01783  *    The user is responsible for freeing the array. The routine casts
01784  *    to the requested user type so there is a potential for lost information
01785  *    (e.g. if you cast a floating point number to int it is truncated, not
01786  *    rounded).
01787  *
01788  *    If you are worried about memory or casting, you should use
01789  *    fc_getVariableDataPtr() to get a pointer to the raw data array.
01790  *
01791  * \modifications
01792  *   - 06/09/2006 WSD Created.
01793  */
01794 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceCoordsAsDataType(
01795   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01796   FC_DataType dataType,   /**< input - the data type for the returned coords */
01797   void **coords           /**< output - pointer to coord array */
01798   ) {
01799   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01800   int i;
01801   int numStep;
01802   FC_DataType dataType_orig;
01803   void* coords_orig;
01804   
01805   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01806   if (coords)
01807     *coords = NULL;
01808   
01809   // check input
01810   if (!fc_isSequenceValid(sequence) || !fc_isDataTypeValid(dataType) ||
01811       dataType == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || coords == NULL) {
01812     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01813     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01814   }
01815   
01816   // log message
01817   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting coords for sequence '%s' as type %s", 
01818                 _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence)->header.name,
01819                 fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
01820   
01821   // get sequence info and coords
01822   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(sequence, &numStep, &dataType_orig);
01823   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01824     return rc;
01825   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(sequence, &coords_orig);
01826   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01827     return rc;
01828 
01829   // allocate return array
01830   *coords = malloc(numStep*fc_sizeofDataType(dataType));
01831   if (!*coords) {
01832     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01833     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01834   }
01835   
01836   // special case - the same data type
01837   if (dataType == dataType_orig) {
01838     memcpy(*coords, coords_orig, numStep*fc_sizeofDataType(dataType));
01839     return FC_SUCCESS;
01840   }
01841 
01842   // Fun!
01843   if (dataType == FC_DT_CHAR) {
01844     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_INT) 
01845       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01846         ((char*)(*coords))[i] = ((int*)coords_orig)[i];
01847     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_FLOAT) 
01848       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01849         ((char*)(*coords))[i] = ((float*)coords_orig)[i];
01850     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
01851       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01852         ((char*)(*coords))[i] = ((double*)coords_orig)[i];
01853   }
01854   else if (dataType == FC_DT_INT) {
01855     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_CHAR) 
01856       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01857         ((int*)(*coords))[i] = ((char*)coords_orig)[i];
01858     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_FLOAT) 
01859       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01860         ((int*)(*coords))[i] = ((float*)coords_orig)[i];
01861     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
01862       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01863         ((int*)(*coords))[i] = ((double*)coords_orig)[i];
01864   }
01865   else if (dataType == FC_DT_FLOAT) {
01866     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_CHAR) 
01867       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01868         ((float*)(*coords))[i] = ((char*)coords_orig)[i];
01869     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_INT) 
01870       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01871         ((float*)(*coords))[i] = ((int*)coords_orig)[i];
01872     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
01873       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01874         ((float*)(*coords))[i] = ((double*)coords_orig)[i];
01875   }
01876   else if (dataType == FC_DT_DOUBLE) {
01877     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_CHAR) 
01878       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01879         ((double*)(*coords))[i] = ((char*)coords_orig)[i];
01880     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_INT) 
01881       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01882         ((double*)(*coords))[i] = ((int*)coords_orig)[i];
01883     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_FLOAT) 
01884       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01885         ((double*)(*coords))[i] = ((float*)coords_orig)[i];
01886   }
01887 
01888   return FC_SUCCESS;
01889 }
01890 
01891 //@}
01892 
01893 /** \name Print sequence. */
01894 //-------------------------------
01895 //@{
01896 
01897 /**
01898  * \ingroup  Sequence
01899  * \brief Print sequence meta data to stdout, and optionally the coordinates.
01900  *
01901  * \modifications 
01902  *    - 11/20/03 WSK Created.
01903  *    - 10/31/07 ACG optional precision flag
01904  */
01905 FC_ReturnCode fc_printSequence(
01906   FC_Sequence sequence, /**< input - sequence */
01907   char* label,          /**< input - label to prepend variable name with, 
01908                                      can be NULL */
01909   int print_coords      /**< input - 1 = print the coordinates. 
01910                   2 = print the in exponential notation with 5 digits of precision */
01911 ) {
01912   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01913   int i;
01914   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01915   int numStep;
01916   FC_DataType dataType;
01917   void* dbuf;
01918 
01919   // special case: printing a null handle is not an error
01920   if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(sequence, FC_NULL_SEQUENCE)) {
01921     printf("Sequence: FC_NULL_SEQUENCE\n");
01922     fflush(NULL);
01923     return FC_SUCCESS;
01924   }
01925 
01926   // check input
01927   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01928   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
01929     fc_printfWarningMessage("Deleting FC_NULL_DATASET");
01930     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01931   }
01932 
01933   // log message
01934   fc_printfLogMessage("Printing sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
01935 
01936   // print label & var name
01937   if (label)
01938     printf("%s: ", label);
01939   else
01940     printf("Sequence: ");
01941   printf("'%s'\n", seqSlot->header.name);
01942   fflush(NULL);
01943 
01944   // print meta data
01945   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(sequence, &numStep, &dataType);
01946   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01947     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get info for sequence '%s'",
01948                           seqSlot->header.name);
01949     return rc;
01950   }
01951   printf("%snumStep = %d, dataType = %s\n", INDENT_STR, numStep,
01952          fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
01953   fflush(NULL);
01954 
01955   // print coordinates
01956   if (print_coords) {
01957     rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(sequence, &dbuf);
01958     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01959       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get coords for sequence '%s'",
01960                           seqSlot->header.name);
01961       return rc;
01962     }
01963     
01964     // print the coordinates
01965     printf("%sCoordinates:\n", INDENT_STR);
01966     fflush(NULL);
01967     switch (dataType) {
01968     case FC_DT_CHAR: 
01969       {
01970         char* cast_buf = (char *)dbuf;
01971         for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01972           printf("%s%s%d:  %c\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01973       }
01974       break;
01975     case FC_DT_INT:
01976       {
01977         int* cast_buf = (int *)dbuf;
01978         for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) 
01979           printf("%s%s%d:  %d\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01980       }
01981       break;
01982     case FC_DT_FLOAT:
01983       {
01984         float* cast_buf = (float *)dbuf;
01985         for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) 
01986           printf("%s%s%d:  %.6g\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01987       }
01988       break;
01989     case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
01990       {
01991         double* cast_buf = (double *)dbuf;
01992         for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) 
01993        switch(print_coords){
01994        case 2:
01995          printf("%s%s%d:  %5leg\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01996          break;
01997        default:
01998          printf("%s%s%d:  %.15g\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01999          break;
02000        }
02001       }
02002       break;
02003     case FC_DT_UNKNOWN:
02004       printf("Cannot print data type '%s'\n", fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
02005     }
02006     fflush(NULL);
02007   }
02008 
02009   return FC_SUCCESS;
02010 }

02014 /**
02015  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02016  * \brief  Initialize a sequence slot
02017  *
02018  * \modifications  
02019  *   APR-30-2003  W Koegler  Created.
02020  */
02021 void _fc_initSeqSlot(
02022   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot    /**< input - the qtable slot to initialize */
02023 ) {
02024   if (seqSlot != NULL) {
02025     _fc_initSlotHeader(&seqSlot->header);
02026     seqSlot->ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
02027     seqSlot->numStep = 0;
02028     seqSlot->datatype = FC_DT_UNKNOWN;
02029     seqSlot->coords = NULL;
02030   }   
02031 }
02032 
02033 /**
02034  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02035  * \brief  Release non-necessary resources in a sequence slot.
02036  *
02037  * \description
02038  *  
02039  *    Releases the coordinates.
02040  *
02041  * \modifications  
02042  *   2003-APR-17  W Koegler  Created
02043  */
02044 void _fc_releaseSeqSlot(
02045   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlotp    /**< input - qtable pointer */
02046 ) {
02047 
02048   // release big data
02049   if (seqSlotp->coords)
02050     free(seqSlotp->coords);
02051   seqSlotp->coords = NULL;
02052     
02053   return;
02054 }
02055 
02056 /**
02057  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02058  * \brief  Clear a sequence slot.
02059  *
02060  * \description
02061  *  
02062  *    Releases all dynamically allocated resources in a sequence,
02063  *    and reinitializes all members.
02064  *
02065  * \modifications  
02066  *   - 2003-APR-17  W Koegler  Created
02067  *   - 2003-APR-31  W Koegler  Made more comprehensive
02068  */
02069 void _fc_clearSeqSlot(
02070  _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlotp       /**< input - qtable pointer */
02071 ) {
02072   if (seqSlotp != NULL) {
02073     // release big data
02074     _fc_releaseSeqSlot(seqSlotp);
02075 
02076     // free other dynamic arrays, if any
02077 
02078     // clear table header
02079     _fc_clearSlotHeader(&seqSlotp->header);
02080 
02081     // reinit
02082     _fc_initSeqSlot(seqSlotp);
02083   }
02084 }

02086 /**
02087  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02088  * \brief  Get the size of the sequence table.
02089  *
02090  * \modifications  
02091  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
02092  */
02093 int _fc_getSeqTableSize() {
02094   return seqTableSize;
02095 }
02096 
02097 /**
02098  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02099  * \brief   Get an empty sequence slot from the sequence table.
02100  *
02101  * \description
02102  *  
02103  *    Will return a new slot or NULL. A NULL means a memory error occurred.
02104  *
02105  * \modifications  
02106  *    - 2003-MAY-01  W Koegler  Created
02107  *    - 12/08/03 WSK Changed because changed XTables from arrays of slots
02108  *      to arrays of handles to slots. The _fc_new_XSlot() routines do
02109  *      not call a common helper routine anymore.
02110  *    - 5/11/04 WSK  Moved common code from _fc_getNewDsSlot(), 
02111  *      _fc_getNewSeqSlot(), etc to _fc_getNewSlot().
02112  */
02113 _FC_SeqSlot* _fc_getNewSeqSlot() {
02114   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
02115 
02116   seqSlot = (_FC_SeqSlot*) _fc_getNewSlot(&seqTableSize, 
02117                            (_FC_SlotHeader***)&seqTable, 
02118                            &seqOpenSlots, sizeof(_FC_SeqSlot));
02119   _fc_initSeqSlot(seqSlot);
02120 
02121   return seqSlot;
02122 }
02123 
02124 /**
02125  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02126  * \brief Get a sequence slot from a sequence handle.
02127  *
02128  * \description
02129  *g 
02130  *    The slot id of the sequence handle is used to find the
02131  *    the slot in the sequence table. The identity is then
02132  *    verified by checking that the slot and the handle's
02133  *    uIDs are the same. On success, a pointer to the slot 
02134  *    is returned. Otherwise a NULL pointer is returned.
02135  *
02136  * \modifications 
02137  *   - 2003-OCT-19  WSK  Created to replace using _fc_checkhandle and GET_ID 
02138  *       for better type checking (using pointer's to slots is less bug
02139  *       prone than lot's of xxxTable[xxxID] references).
02140  *   - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_isHandleValid common to all tables.
02141  */
02142 _FC_SeqSlot* _fc_getSeqSlot(
02143   FC_Sequence sequence    /**< input - sequence */
02144 ) {
02145   if (_fc_isHandleValid(sequence.slotID, sequence.uID, seqTableSize,
02146                         (_FC_SlotHeader**)seqTable))
02147     return seqTable[sequence.slotID];
02148   else
02149     return NULL;
02150 }
02151 
02152 /**
02153  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02154  *
02155  * \brief Get a sequence slot based on ID.
02156  *
02157  * \description
02158  * 
02159  *    The _FC_SeqSlot at the requested slotID is returned. This should
02160  *    only be used when you really know that it is the slot you want
02161  *    because there is no checking of the uID like with _fc_getSeqSlot.
02162  *    The only checking is that the slotID is exists in the table and
02163  *    that the uID is > 0 (i.e. it is not empty).
02164  *
02165  * \modifications 
02166  *    - 11/27/03 WSK Created so that external routines can index into
02167  *      tables without knowing about them.
02168  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_getSlot() common to all tables.
02169  */
02170 _FC_SeqSlot* _fc_getSeqSlotFromID(
02171   int seqID
02172 ) {
02173   return (_FC_SeqSlot*) _fc_getSlot(seqID, seqTableSize, 
02174                                     (_FC_SlotHeader**)seqTable);
02175 }
02176 
02177 /**
02178  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02179  * \brief Delete the sequence slot associated with the sequence handle.
02180  *
02181  * \description 
02182  *    
02183  *    This routine clears the dynamic data in the slot and then
02184  *    deletes the slot from the table.
02185  *
02186  * \modifications
02187  *   - 12/20/2005 WSD. Created.
02188  */
02189 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteSeqSlot(
02190   FC_Sequence sequence    /**< input - sequence */
02191 ) {
02192   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
02193   
02194   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
02195   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
02196     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02197     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02198   }
02199 
02200   // do it
02201   _fc_clearSeqSlot(seqSlot);
02202   return _fc_deleteSlot(seqSlot->header.slotID, seqTableSize, 
02203                (_FC_SlotHeader**)seqTable, &seqOpenSlots);
02204 }
02205 
02206 /**
02207  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02208  * \brief  Print the contents of the Sequence Table (\ref seqTable) to stderr.
02209  *
02210  * \description
02211  *
02212  *    Prints the contents of the Sequence Table in a human readable form.
02213  *    It takes a string to use as a label for this print out of the table.
02214  *    Pass NULL if you don't want a label.
02215  *
02216  * \modifications 
02217  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
02218  *    - 2003-NOV-13  WSK  Fixed up.
02219  */
02220 void _fc_printSeqTable(
02221   char *label  /**< Input - label for this version the table (without a
02222                            trailing \\n) pass NULL if no label is desired */
02223 ) {
02224   int i;
02225   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
02226   
02227   // print table heading
02228   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
02229   fprintf(stderr, "Sequence Table (seqTable):\n");
02230   if (label != NULL)
02231     fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", label);
02232   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
02233   fflush(NULL);
02234 
02235   // We're done if it's empty
02236   if (seqTableSize < 1) {
02237     fprintf(stderr, "(empty)\n");
02238     fprintf(stderr, "\n");
02239     fflush(NULL);
02240     return;
02241   }
02242 
02243   // print contents for each slot
02244   for (i = 0; i < seqTableSize; i++) {
02245     seqSlot = seqTable[i];
02246     fprintf(stderr, "%3d: %s\n", i, (seqSlot) ? "exists" : "NULL");
02247     if (seqSlot == NULL)
02248       continue;
02249     _fc_printSlotHeader(seqSlot->header);
02250     fprintf(stderr, "     FC_Dataset = { %d, %d }\n",
02251             seqSlot->ds.slotID, seqSlot->ds.uID);
02252     fprintf(stderr, "     numStep = %d, datatype = %s, coords = %s\n", 
02253             seqSlot->numStep, fc_getDataTypeText(seqSlot->datatype),
02254             (seqSlot->coords) ? "exists" : "NULL");
02255   }
02256   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
02257   fflush(NULL);
02258 
02259   return;
02260 }
02261 
02262 /**
02263  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02264  * \brief  Free all entries in the sequence table
02265  *
02266  * \description
02267  *
02268  *    This should only be called after making sure that
02269  *    all slots have been cleared.
02270  *
02271  * \modifications  
02272  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
02273  */
02274 void _fc_freeSeqTable() {
02275   int i;
02276   for (i = 0; i < seqTableSize; i++) {
02277     _fc_clearSeqSlot(seqTable[i]);
02278     free(seqTable[i]);
02279   }
02280   free(seqTable);
02281   fc_freeSortedIntArray(&seqOpenSlots);
02282   seqTableSize = 0;
02283   seqTable = NULL;
02284 }
